p: It is becoming increasingly apparent that the importance of interspecific differences in key traits not only leads to different species having different functional roles ( Dias et al. 2013, Zimmer et al. 2002) but also causes different species to be affected differently by climate change ( Veldhuis et al. 2017). Because ecosystem science has yet to embrace how principles of evolutionary ecology explain the ways in which organisms mediate ecosystem carbon dynamics ( Schmitz 2013), there is an urgent need to increase our understanding of how differential impacts of climate change on basic biological traits of individual species can lead to changes in community structure and function ( Jiguet et al. 2011).
